notes.note: Students may not take both DSOC 1101 and SOC 1101 for credit.

course.subject: DSOC
course.course_title: FWS: The Cultural Politics of Reproduction

course.subject: DSOC
course.course_title: FWS: Precarious Work and Workers in the Global Food System

notes.note: Juniors and Seniors may choose to take course for 1 additional credit if selected from applicant pool during first week of class. To earn 1 additional credit student must attend ADDITIONAL section meeting on Friday immediately following regular class discussion time. All students must initially enroll in LEC 1, DIS 1 for 3 credits. If course full, contact ct259@cornell.edu to be placed on waitlist. This does NOT guarantee enrollment.
Prerequisite: introductory social science course or permission of instructor.

course.subject: DSOC
course.course_title: Social Indicators and Introduction to Social Science Research

course.subject: DSOC
course.course_title: Rethinking Global Development: New Frameworks for Understanding Poverty, Inequality & Growth in 21C

notes.note: Prerequisite: DSOC 2050, International Development or permission of instructor.
Sections will be scheduled during the first day of class.
Prerequisite: introductory social science course.
Prerequisites: Permission of instructor. A background in statistics will be helpful.

course.subject: DSOC
course.course_title: CALS NYS Internship Program Preparation and Community Orientation

notes.note: Course will be limited to CALS students who have successfully applied (i.e, been accepted) to the CALS NYS Internship Program for the following summer.
Prereq: One demography course or permission of instructor.

course.subject: DSOC
course.course_title: Social Studies of Space, Technologies and Borders

notes.note: Please contact course instructor for application if you are interested in enrolling in this course.

Students from all colleges must submit an Independent Study Form (Available online: http://cals.cornell.edu/academics/registrar/policies/#independent-study). Do not sign into section 601. You will be put in the course after submitting form online.

Previous enrollment in the course to be taught or other appropriate previous training and experience. You will be put in the course after submitting form online.
